span.span: 4/27/2020 Remote Meeting of the Early ISD Board of Trustees:

Pursuant to the Governor Abbott’s Temporary Suspension of Open Meetings Laws issued on March 16, 2020 and consistent with new state and local mandates on public health and social distancing, the Early ISD Board of Trustees will conduct a virtual Call Meeting at 6:00 pm. on 4/27/2020. This meeting will be conducted via Zoom, which will be audible to the Board and public. A quorum of the Board of Trustees will not be physically present at one location, and for safety reasons we will not be permitted in-person attendance by members of the public or staff. You may access the live meeting here https://us04web.zoom.us/j/72479073682?pwd=aHpTZ0FPRFo2TnIIzQnB0NmFYUT09 password 4k7PuJ. An electronic copy will be available for agenda packet may be viewed here at
. An audio recording of the open meeting will be available for viewing online following the meeting.

a.aria-label: Read more about Public Notice Board Meeting
Read more about Pre-K & Kindergarten Round Up

div.p: Families who would like for their child to attend Early ISD school outside of the district in which they reside in 2020-2021 may apply online for a transfer beginning April 1.
When applying for a transfer, remember to use your legal name and not a nickname.
Click on the link to get started:

a.aria-label: Read more about Transfers for 2020-2021

div.p: Parents or guardians needing to find nearby locations of schools offering free school meals (both breakfast and lunch for pick up) while school buildings are closed. Select "Meal Pick-Up Locations" and enter an address to find the closest location.

a.aria-label: Read more about MEAL LOCATIONS

div.p:
EISD Faculty, Staff, and Parents,
I want to thank you for your patience regarding the communication of information pertaining to the Coronavirus Pandemic. A school closure protocol has been issued by the Center for Disease Control and Prevention that outlines steps for schools to consider. Due to the recent availability of COVID-19 (Coronavirus) test kits in Brown County, we have decided to wait until results from these tests are made available before allowing students to return to school. Classes for students will be suspended through March 22nd. Faculty and staff that have not traveled to high risk areas will return Monday to assist in communicating with families that we have not received travel information from. Staff will be participating in professional development activities Monday - Friday with the plan for students to return to school on Monday, 22nd. The current situation; however, is still extremely fluid, and it is the goal of EISD to return students to a safe environment where learning will occur.
We are taking these steps out of an abundance of caution and believe this is the most prudent action at this time given the number of EISD-Connected people who may have been exposed while traveling and may not yet show symptoms. I understand the disappointment and inconvenience these decisions have caused many of you. In order for us to keep everyone at EISD as safe as possible, families are encouraged to help the District identify travel risks by completing the following Google Form survey. Please fill out the form even if you did not travel at all over the break.
Please complete this form on behalf of each child and staff member.
The UIL has suspended all extra-curricular contest until March 31st, and EISD will suspend all practices and after school student activities until students return on Monday, 23rd.
Please continue to adhere to health and safety guidelines posted by public officials. I am also including the latest updated information from the Texas Education Agency at the link below.
https://tea.texas.gov/about-tea/news-and-multimedia/correspondence/taa-letters/tea-update-covid-19-initial-guidance-and-faqs
We will keep you posted if anything changes.
Sincerely,
Wes Beck
Superintendent EISD

h3.a: Lisa Hunter Brown County Voted Best Teacher

div.p: Best of Brown County BEST TEACHER 2019, as voted by Brown County citizens. Mrs. Hunter has served Early ISD for 20 years; Three years in Special Ed, sixteen years in 5th grade, and starting her second year teaching 3rd grade. Mrs. Hunter said, "I've not worked anywhere else because Early is the BEST place to teach!"

a.aria-label: Read more about Lisa Hunter Brown County Voted Best Teacher

College Scorecard- This site helps ensure that students and families have the most up to date, reliable information on colleges throughout . . .

div.p:
2018-19 Tests:
October 16-18, 2018
January 15-17,2019
June 11-13, 2019
August 4-6, 2019
Requirements to receive credit:
If a student plans to take an exam, the student (or a parent) must register with the campus counselor no later than 30 days prior to the scheduled testing date.
Credit by exam without prior instruction (no class taken) - the student must make at least a 80
Credit by exam with prior instruction (one year of classroom instruction in the subject to be tested) - the student must make at least a 70

a.aria-label: Read more about Credit By Exam
